Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2010 02:50AM misfit wrote: I had trouble with my eyes after my 2nd AC. It's kind of hard to explain, they were watery and sticky. It was worse outdoors and especially in the sun. I woke up in the morning looking like I'd been crying all night. I tried eyedrops and natural tears but that didn't help. Things got better by my last treatment and resolved completely shortly after. Hopefully the problems you are having are only temporary as well.
Posts.Title: Anyone have Eye Problems with AC Lovelyface anonymice

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2010 06:01PM misfit wrote: I'm 41 and mine came back four months after chemo (though I had a different regimen than you). Not as heavy as before but same duration. That was six weeks ago. Haven't had another one yet but I definitely had pms for a few days. I guess I'll just have to wait and see.
Posts.Title: Return of menses LtotheK slanderson

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2011 12:14AM misfit wrote: My hair is sticking out a bit too but my wig is long enough so it isn't that noticeable. I was thinking about just gelling those pieces back behind my ears. Without the wig I look like a guy wearing makeup, so I won't be ditching it anytime soon.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Dec 28, 2010 01:42AM misfit wrote: It's been 4 months and my hair is only an inch long...damn. But I got a new wig last month that I love and I often forget I'm wearing it (I guess I'm just used to wearing wigs now). Sadly, it does look better than the hair I had. I have to say I'm super excited that my real hair seems to have a bit of curl to it. All my life I've had really straight hair so this is great. And no grey, which surprised me since I had a little bit before. At least now that I know what real bad hair days are I'll probably never complain about that again. Does anyone have or is anyone planning on getting hair extensions? How long does your hair have to be?
